description: Installation of 6 no. antennas, 2 no. transmission dishes, 1 no, equipment cabinet, 3 no. flat pack frames and ancillary development including Remote Radio Units (RRUs) and GPS module.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

100 Rev E; 200 Rev F; 201 Rev F; 210 Rev G; 214 Rev F; 300 Rev D; 301 Rev F; 302 Rev D; 303 Rev F; Photomontage Pack V2; Cornerstone Planning Cover Letter (29 November 2024); Matt Warman MP Letter to LPA Chiefs (24 May 2021); Matt Warman MP Letter on 5G (November 2019); Mobile UK 5G Local Authority Toolkit; Cornerstone Radio Planning and Propagation information sheet (04 November 2019); Cornerstone Constraints and Solutions for Rooftop Deployments Information Sheet; The Institution of Engineering Technology - Allaying Health Concerns Regarding 5G; Clarke Telecom Consultation Letter (05 June 2019); Cornerstone o ICNIRP Declaration & Clarification Statement (29 November 2024); Cornerstone Site Specific Supplementary Information (22 March 2024); DCMS MHCLG Collaborating for Digital Connectivity (07 March 2019); Cornerstone Digital Public Benefit Brochure; Cornerstone General Background Information for Telecommunications Development; GSMA 5G EMF Exposure & Safety; Cornerstone Health and Mobile Phone Base Stations document (11 May 2021); HM Government 5G Mobile Technology Guide; Mobile UK 5G Masts and Health Fact Sheet; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - Planning for a better network; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - 5G Services; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - Coverage and Capacity; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - Safety Guidelines on electromagnetic fields from antennas; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - Health Summary; Cornerstone Community Information Sheet - How it works; Cornerstone Local Authority Engagement Brochure. 

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
Condition : 3 - The colour of the proposed antennas and cables shall match as closely as possible the external surface to which they are attached. All other new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.     

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policy D1 and D2 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017. 
Condition : 4 - The apparatus hereby approved shall be removed from the building as soon as reasonably practicable when no longer required. 

Reason: In order to minimize the impact on the appearance of the building and local environment in accordance with the requirements of Policies D1 and D2 of the London Borough of Camden Local Plan 2017.
